title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Localizability-Enhanced Navigation in Dynamic Human Environments. (arXiv:2303.12354v1 [cs.RO])
abstract: Reliable localization is crucial for autonomous robots to navigate efficiently and safely. Some navigation methods can plan paths with high localizability (which describes the capability of acquiring reliable localization). By following these paths, the robot can access the sensor streams that facilitate more accurate location estimation results by the localization algorithms. However, most of these methods require prior knowledge and struggle to adapt to unseen scenarios or dynamic changes. To overcome these limitations, we propose a novel approach for localizability-enhanced navigation via deep reinforcement learning in dynamic human environments. Our proposed planner automatically extracts geometric features from 2D laser data that are helpful for localization. The planner learns to assign different importance to the geometric features and encourages the robot to navigate through areas that are helpful for laser localization. translated_abstract: 可靠的定位对于自主机器人的高效和安全导航至关重要。一些导航方法可以规划高可定位性的路径。通过按照这些路径行进，机器人可以获取传感器流，从而通过定位算法得出更准确的位置估计结果。然而，大多数这些方法需要先验知识，并且难以适应未知场景或动态变化。为了克服这些限制，我们提出了一种利用深度强化学习进行动态人类环境中增强可定位性导航的新方法。我们提出的路径规划器可以自动从2D激光数据中提取几何特征，这些特征对于定位是有帮助的。规划器学习分配不同的重要性给几何特征，并鼓励机器人通过有助于激光定位的区域进行导航。为了促进规划器的学习，我们提供了两种技巧。
tldr: 本研究提出了一种在动态人类环境中增强可定位性导航的新方法，可以自动提取几何特征来帮助机器人定位，通过深度强化学习，规划器可以学习分配不同的重要性给几何特征，并鼓励机器人通过有助于激光定位的区域进行导航。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel approach for localizability-enhanced navigation via deep reinforcement learning in dynamic human environments. The proposed planner automatically extracts geometric features from 2D laser data that are helpful for localization, and learns to assign different importance to the geometric features to encourage robot navigation through areas that facilitate more accurate location estimation results.
